title: Madonna's Madame X Tour of theaters rakes in $9.6 million for opening 16 dates in Brooklyn
text:
Madonna's 90-date, Madame X Tour marks the first time the iconic artist is playing smaller venues since she hit the road in support of Like A Virgin in 1985.

Her gamble to give her fans a more intimate setting in exchange for a higher price tag appears to have been a rousing success, according to the first numbers from her opening stint at Brooklyn's Howard Gilman Opera House.

The pop icon grossed about $9.6 million for the initial 16 sold-out dates, as reported by Billboard Boxscore.

Madonna's Madame X Tour grossed about $9.6 million for its first 16 dates at Brooklyn's Howard Gilman Opera House starting September 27

Averaging just under 2,000 seats per night, the run from September 27 to October 12 in New York, resulted in a total of 31,041 tickets sold.

Tickets for the new tour ranged from as low as $50 to $757 on the high end.

In all, the average ticket sold for $306.73, which is a major increase from her career average ticket sale amount of $115.81.

Averaging just under 2,000 seats per night, Madonna's run from September 27 to October 12 in New York, resulted in a total of 31,041 tickets sold

In comparison, Madonna averaged $125.46 in the 2000s and $147.33 in the current decade. But the True Blue singer was able to charge a more reasonable price because she was playing much larger venues that included arenas and stadiums.

The Madame X Tour is currently in the middle of its residency in Chicago that goes until October 28.

From there, it will move to San Francisco and Las Vegas for three date stints.

The theaters tour also includes stops in Los Angeles, Boston, Philadelphia, Miami Beach, before heading to Europe for a run of shows in Lisbon, London and Paris.

Intimate setting: In all, the average ticket sold for $306.73, which is a major increase from her career average ticket sale amount of $115.81

With about 75 shows to go, The Madame X Tour is currently projected to generate between $50 million and $55 million. But that number could soar past the $60 million mark because many of the upcoming theaters are larger than the initial venue in Brooklyn.

Madonna is the second highest-grossing solo artist in the history of Billboard Boxscore behind Bruce Springsteen.

With more than 300 million records sold worldwide, she's also the best-selling female recording artist of all time by Guinness World Records.
description: Madonna's Madame X Tour of theaters raked in nearly $10 million for its opening 16-dates in Brooklyn, according to Billboard Boxscore.
